author: nc1234
content: Do we need a eventstream for IL? I saw terence's note that it's to be discussed. Personally I can't think of a use case for it

author: terencechain
content:
I think we may need it for builders in the mev-boost pipeline... Otherwise I dont know how builders will be able to get the ILs.. they either can
- Listen to the p2p directly 
- Get it through some beacon api end points. Streaming is one option here for couse 

I dont think you can add ILs to the `GetHeader` call because at that point the block is already made and relayer has it

author: nflaig
content:
Two questions regarding IL size and number of transactions
- is `MAX_TRANSACTIONS_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` defined anywhere yet or is there a preliminary value we wanna use, we just set this to 1 right now which does not seems right to me
- `MAX_BYTES_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` does this refer to size of transactions (ie. `signed_inclusion_list.message.transactions` ) or `signed_inclusion_list.message` as noted in the spec PR, it makes more sense to me to only apply this to transactions since other fields in container are limited in size already

author: jih2nn
content:
- `MAX_TRANSACTIONS_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` was considered before we adopted size limit. Currently, it's just a placeholder for the parameter definition in the spec and we don't really use it for other purpose than that.
- `MAX_BYTES_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` refers to size of transactions.

author: jih2nn
content: Sounds good to me. It seems the legacy keeps confusing the readers. cc <@363800010518822915>

author: terencechain
content:
I think we should follow `ExecutionPayload`. It should be defined as a ssz list, so the consensus is on the max limit. In Prysm I just followed the samething as `ExecutionPaload`: `List[Transaction, MAX_TRANSACTIONS_PER_PAYLOAD]` and use the same value for `MAX_BYTES_PER_TRANSACTION`
But the actual check is `MAX_BYTES_PER_INCLUSION_LIST` for at the gossip pipeline
